title: ImportError: No module named future.utils
body_html:
Commit c22dcc2 introduced a dependency on the package future. Since the torch package does not declare a dependency on future, this error happens.

# python
Python 2.7.9 (default, Jun 29 2016, 13:08:31)
[GCC 4.9.2] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> from torch.utils.cpp_extension import include_paths
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/utils/cpp_extension.py", line 13, in <module>
    from future.utils import raise_from
ImportError: No module named future.utils
>>>
body_text:
Commit c22dcc2 introduced a dependency on the package future. Since the torch package does not declare a dependency on future, this error happens.
# python
Python 2.7.9 (default, Jun 29 2016, 13:08:31)
[GCC 4.9.2] on linux2

Traceback (most recent call last):

body:
Commit https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/c22dcc266ff29e71f5d0d2ddacb9362ddef062d7 introduced a dependency on the package `future`. Since the `torch` package does not declare a dependency on `future`, this error happens.

```
# python
Python 2.7.9 (default, Jun 29 2016, 13:08:31)
[GCC 4.9.2] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> from torch.utils.cpp_extension import include_paths
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/utils/cpp_extension.py", line 13, in <module>
    from future.utils import raise_from
ImportError: No module named future.utils
>>>
```
